result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro Alejandro Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are to be paid as follows:  $50 is due on or before February 1, 2018 and then $50 is due by the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in serving 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Credit for time served, which is deemed time served.
Added to payment plan.  DNA surcharge waived on Count 2.

Credit for time served, which is deemed time served.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Pedro Alejandro Perez
Current: 825 W. Silver Lake Drive NE, C/O Cronin Homes, Rochester, MN 55906 United States  (Effective: 01-02-2018)
Prior: 13 West Windsor St., Kasson, MN 55944 United States

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel SPD Carly Sebion, appearing specially for Amanda Roush.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State indicates victim notification has been complied with.  Will plead to duplicate charges in Counts 1 & 3 - pleas of guilty on both - DC as domestic.  Charges involve someone he has a child with.  Court reviews elements.  Counts 2 & 4 will be dismissed and read-in.  Court performs plea collquy/waiver of rights with defendant.  He is not considering probation.  Attorney Sebion states that Attorney Roush met with him last week and went through everything with him.  Attorney Sebion believes he understands.  Court finds he FVKI enters his plea/waives his rights; factual basis exists and is found guilty on both Counts 1 & 3.  Counts 2 & 4 are DRI. 

State requests a 45 - ?? days jail sentence on each case to run concurrent.  Has 64 days jail credit per Attorney Roush.  Defense makes a statement to the Court and agrees with the recommendation.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  

Court adopts the joint recommendation and orders 45 days jail on Count 1 and and 60 days jail on Count 3, concurrent, which is deemed time served on both.  Must pay court costs with DNA surcharge and finds he's unable to pay the DNA surcharge on Count 2.  Payment plan of $50 per month starting 2-1-18.  He is to let clerk know the mailing address.  **Updated maiing address:  C/O Cronin Homes, 825 W. Silver Lake Dr., NE, Rochestser, MN 55906.  Defense will update his mailing address within 72 hours if the sober house address is incorrect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 2, 2018 at 09:45 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Roush.  Have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Amanda Roush
Defendant appears by video from JASO with counsel SPD Amanda Roush present.  Special Prosecutor William Nemer appears for the State.

Pre-trial conference on November 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Court Commissioner Rewald at 9 a.m. Recorded:
Defendant appears by video from JASO with counsel SPD Amanda Roush present.  She was just appointed this morning and wasn't able to talk to him.  Special Prosecutor William Nemer appears for the State.  Adjourned to 1:00 today.

On record at 1:00 p.m.:  
Defendant appears by video from JASO with counsel SPD Amanda Roush present.  William Nemer appears for the State.  Address is correct.  State requests an additional $500 cash bond. Defense counsel states he is not going to be able to post and is in jail on a $200 cash bond now.  

Court orders $200 cash bond to remain as previously ordered.

PTC 11-22-17 and STC 11-27 at 3 p.m.

DA requests a signature bond with a no contact with the victim.  Court sets $500 sig bond with conditions as requested by ADA Inlow.  AIA set for 1-4-16 at 9:30.  Court explained the bond to the defendant.  He states he has clothes at the residence.  Court instructs him the sheriff's department can assist him to retrieve his personal items from the residence.
